item.title: The Permanent Portfolio Redux
item.description: Introduction Many people obsess about which stock to buy and when to sell it, but research shows that asset allocation is the largest determinant of portfolio performance. Back around 1980 Harry Browne proposed what he called the Permanent Portfolio. He advocated that you could set it up in 30 minutes and have lifelong financial security. He published a book called Fail-Safe Investing in 2001. Most research has shown that the permanent portfolio has held up pretty well.
